favourite.article: Thank You Lord for the cross. It reminds me of how You love me.
The Spirit woke me up with this divine song this morning. So grateful. He is nearer then you can imagine. Amen.

This song came to my heart about a week ago. It's such a great timeless gospel hymn!! I remember singing it in church! I'm glad I was able to find it here!! Yes indeed we are closer everyday to the coming of our Lord Jesus!! Let's keep praying witnessing and encouraging one another in the body of Christ!!

Maybe this song was translated into another language, then back to English. It's close enough. All the verses are beautiful and wonderful. We can sing every one of them in praise to God for the peace that lies just beyond. Hallelujah brethren, we are very close to the Eternal Kingdom!
Amen, Lord Jesus. The cross is the razor that shaves our flesh daily.
Sing on all you soldiers of the cross with Heaven in view, because we will soon cross the river to find eternal REST. HALLELUJAH!!!!!!!!
The chorus I grew up with was: "In the cross, in the cross Be my glory ever, Til at last my soul shall find Rest beyond the river." This was in a tiny Baptist church in Englehart, Ontario, Canada.
This Song Has Blessed my life and will Continue to Bless me. My singular Prayer for the Writer of this Hymn is That She Finds Rest Beyond The River...Haleluyah...
(Chorus) In the cross, in the cross, Be my glory ever; till my raptured soul shall find rest beyond the River

The significance of the Cross in our Christian lives cannot be over emphasized, to be victorious one has to choose the Cross without hesitation. Jesus Christ died for all believers; what is important to make a closer step each day towards the golden strand with the Messiah by your side in order to attain the peaceful rest beyond that river.

The original words of the hymn are deeply inspiring. The fourth stanza states - Near the cross I'll watch and wait, Hoping Trusting Ever Till I reach the golden strand, Just beyond the river.
And the chorus states- In the cross, in the cross Be my glory ever Till my raptured soul shall find Rest beyond the river.
Please I'd like to know how to play piano. Also we be use in our church. Thanks. Great job.
I really like this song. God bless you.
The hymn is deeply inspiring, reminding me always where my glory lies. But why did you change the chorus, pls can we know?

I love this hymn! But where did you find your version of the chorus. It doesn't come from Fanny Crosby who wrote the song. Just wondering. When I did our church bulletin for tonight I did not catch that difference in time. And I do prefer Fanny Crosby's word. God bless.
My strength is renewed when ever I listen to these inspire words, this must be the going of the Holy Spirit. The cross is our path to destiny and the hope for eternity. God bless the writer.

I remember the late Pentecostal Apostolic Bishop David L. Ellis used to sing this hymn all the time and even recorded different versions of it on his Traditional Gospel albums in the 1990's. May the legacy of the man who wrote this beautiful hymn live on forever!
God bless you for singing such a song.
I always feel humbled when I think of the writer of this song. I have always shared the testimony of the writer of this song to many. May the Lord bless more as they sing this song.

Thanks be to God for His blessing and mercy upon me every day of my life. I will keep on serving Him till I see His face. God bless the writer of this song. This song keep holding me, and I do believe that there is a true living God.

This is another Fanny Crosby/William Doane collaboration. In this case, Doane's tune came first, and Crosby's words after. When hymns are composed in this way, the words sometimes seem stilted and unnatural, but not here. Crosby was masterful at hearing the message in the music. She would often say, "That tune says to me ...,", and then write a stirring text. - Great Songs of Faith by Brown & Norton
Beautifully coded and played.... will sing with joyful lips... Jesus keep me the cross.
Praise the Lord in the highest ~ Thank God for Fanny Crosby who had wrote such a wonderful hymn for us.
So beautiful....Jesus, My Lord and God, You are the Lover of my soul...
My late sweet mum taught me the tune and lyrics of this powerful hymn. I worship God and thank Him for allowing me the pleasure of such a great mother. Thank you.
This hymn pours fresh streams of God's grace and love into my soul. It reminds me of the great price His beloved Son has to pay for my sins. I worship and thank the Lord with this hymn.
It lightens and strengthens me when I am down. It fills my heart with love and eyes with tears remembering of my Saviour. Love You Jesus, forgive my sins.

In reply to last posting, someone has just this evening given me a sheet from a hymnbook and the words are slightly different (Number 312 in this particular book).
For example the last two lines of the chorus are:
"Till my raptured soul shall find Rest beyond the river"
and the fourth verse finishes with "Till I reach the golden strand Just beyond the river"
If these sound familiar I am sure you can find this version. I just don't have the name of the hymnal.
The melody takes me back and is still moving. But the words here do not quite fit with those I sang and remember. Does anyone know if there were two versions?
This has been such a blessing to our family. Praise be unto the Lord
This was one of John Sung's favourite hymns. He sang it just before he went to be with the Lord. Lovely hymn!
This song really touches me when I sing it, it really blesses me and makes to be near my God.

I played this song at mass recently and was somewhat surprised it wasn't well known by the congregation.
No matter, they'll learn if I keep playing it ! Its a lovely melody and the lyrics really do reach out in prayer.
As was done for Fanny, I'd like someone to play this at my funeral. I'd want to leave with words like these
God bless

I am a Chinese Christian. The song 'Near the cross' is very good and touching.
In Jesus Christ Kwan Ka Yee
